title.rendered: South Africa vs Bangladesh, Women’s T20 World Cup 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

South Africa: Laura Wolvaardt, Tazmin Brits, Marizanne Kapp, Sune Luus (c), Chloe Tryon, Nadine de Klerk, Delmi Tucker, Sinalo Jafta (wk), Shabnim Ismail, Masabata Klaas, Nonkululeko Mlaba

Bangladesh: Shamima Sultana (wk), Murshida Khatun, Sobhana Mostary, Nigar Sultana (c), Shorna Akter, Rumana Ahmed, Ritu Moni, Nahida Akter, Fahima Khatun, Salma Khatun, Marufa Akter

Venue: Newlands, Cape Town

Pitch Report

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 164

2nd innings average score: 118

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 66%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

From the current South Africa squad, Sune Luus (35) and Marizanne Kapp (33) have the best batting average against Bangladesh. Kapp is the leading wicket-taker (11).

Shabnim Ismail is the second-highest wicket-taker (9), including the best figures of 3 for 19, for South Africa against Bangladesh.

From the current lot, Salma Khatun (10) and Rumana Ahmed (7) are the highest wicket-takers against South Africa. While Khatun has the best figures of 3 for 20, Ahmed’s best effort reads 2 for 19.

Marufa Akter has taken the most wickets (4) for Bangladesh in this competition. When she last visited Newlands, she bagged a three-for.

In her last game at Cape Town, Shorna Akter showed plenty of promise by finishing as the top-scorer (31) for her side.

In four innings against South Africa, Nigar Sultana has collected only 14 runs.

Delmi Tucker’s lean run with the bat continues. Her recent scores read 7, 4*, 5, 0, and 1.

In the last three games at Cape Town, 51% of the wickets have been bagged by the spinners.
